leftvalue.name: Égalité
leftvalue.blurb: Those with higher Equality scores believe that ownership should be aquired through work. They tend to support common land ownership, unions, and socialism.

rightvalue.name: Propriété
rightvalue.blurb: Those with higher Property scores believe that ownership should be aquired through claims. They tend to support landlords, wage labor, and class systems.

leftvalue.name: Coordination
leftvalue.blurb: Those with higher Coordination scores believe that resources and production should be focused on needs. They tend to support regulation, high taxation, and economic planning.

rightvalue.name: Commerce
rightvalue.blurb: Those with higher Commerce scores believe that free markets are the best way to distribute resources. They tend to support deregulation, low taxes, and laissez-faire.

leftvalue.name: Dominion
leftvalue.blurb: Those with higher Dominion scores believe that political power should be centralized in the hands of few. They tend to support strong governments, centralism, and autocracy.

rightvalue.name: Anarchie
rightvalue.blurb: Those with higher Anarchy scores believe that political power should be spread amongst the population. They tend to support small governments, localism, and anarchism.

leftvalue.name: Permission
leftvalue.blurb: Those with higher Permission scores believe an individual should be able to act as they please if they aren't harming others. They tend to support free speech, bodily autonomy, and individualism.

rightvalue.name: Restriction
rightvalue.blurb: Those with higher Restriction scores believe that strict rules should be put in place to limit what an individual may do. They tend to support limitations on speech, paternalistic social policy, and collectivism.

leftvalue.name: Inclusivité
leftvalue.blurb: Those with higher Inclusivity scores believe that identity groups in society should be treated equally. They tend to support LGBT+ acceptance, feminism, and racial equality.

rightvalue.name: Suprématie
rightvalue.blurb: Those with higher Supremacy scores tend to believe that identity groups are stratified and more or less valuable. They tend to support sexual norms, gender roles, and racial nationalism.

leftvalue.name: Héritage
leftvalue.blurb: Those with higher Heritage scores believe that rapid change is risky and that the past should be cherished. They tend to support religion, nature, and preserving culture.

rightvalue.name: Nouveauté
rightvalue.blurb: Those with higher Novelty scores believe that holding on to the past is irrational and instead we should look to the future. They tend to support secularism, transhumanism, and rewriting culture.

rawtext.title: DouzeValeurs
rawtext.whatare12v_text: Il y a 6 axes indépendents - Possession, Marché, Pouvoir, Autonomie, Identité et Progrès - et chacun a deux valeurs opposées qui lui sont assignées:

htmltext.whatis_text:
DouzeValeurs est un test politique qui tente de modéliser des perspectives politiques différentes sur six axes. Vous serez mis face à une déclaration et une liste de réponses, de Fortement D'Accord à Fortement En Désaccord. Choisissez la réponse qui correspond le mieux au texte, et rappelez vous de répondre honnêtement.

À la fin du questionnaire, vos résultats vous seront montrés. Puisque des questions affectent plusieurs axes, it est très improbable que vous obteniez 100% pour une valeur, donc ne soyez pas supris si vos résultats semblent plus modérés que vous vous attendiez.
htmltext.whatisclosestmatch_text:
Une fois vos résultats générés, notre test essaiera de vous attribuer une idéologie politique, des 240 possibles, qui est la plus proche de vos scores. Nous vous incitons à en rechercher plus à propos de cette idéologie, pour voir si elle semble correspondre à vos idées.

Si ce n'est pas le cas, dites-le nous, en joignant notre serveur Discord ou notre subreddit, et en proposant des ajouts ou idéologies que vous aimeriez voir ajoutés. DouzeValeurs est censée être contruit et dévelopé collectivement, donc toutes propositions sont les bienvenues.

instructiontext.title: DouzeValeurs
instructiontext.instructiontext: 132 opinions vous seront présentées. Pour chacune, cliquez sur le bouton de votre avis.
